question: For the formation of which compound in Ellingham diagram <katex>$\Delta G^{\circ}$</katex> becomes more and more negative with increase in temperature?
explanation: For the reaction <katex>$2C + O_2 \to 2CO$</katex>, the number of gaseous moles increases, so entropy change is positive. Thus, <katex>$\Delta G = \Delta H - T\Delta S$</katex> becomes more negative as T increases.
